title: Ken Fisher's Top 4th-Quarter Trades
text: Ken Fisher (Trades, Portfolio) has released his portfolio for the fourth quarter. Top trades include changes in his BTC iShares Global Energy ETF (IXC) and Vanguard Intermediate-Term Corporate Bond ETF (NASDAQ:VCIT) holdings as well as boosts in Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL), Amazon.com Inc. (NASDAQ:AMZN) and Microsoft Corp. (NASDAQ:MSFT).

title: Earnings Outlook: Amazon earnings preview: Prime Day and the holidays mean Amazon will add to its most profitable year
text: Amazon.com Inc. has already had its most profitable year. But with Prime Day 2020 taking place in October and the holiday shopping season still to be accounted for, the e-commerce giant will only add to the tally.

title: What You Need To Know In Options, GameStop, Google, Amazon, Snap And More: Week Of February 1
text: Last week saw short squeezes in a handful of names, selling pressure in the major indices and a huge spike in options volatility across the board. With the VIX now above 30, SPY options are pricing a nearly 3% move by Friday.

title: Earnings Previews: What to Expect From Amazon, Alphabet, Alibaba
text: Earnings season continues, and with big names like Apple, Facebook and Tesla already in the books, we're due for the next round of heavy hitters.

title: Amazon expands its biometric-based Amazon One palm reader system to more retail stores
text: Last fall, Amazon introduced a new biometric device, Amazon One, that allowed customers to pay at Amazon Go stores using their palm. Today, the company says the device is being rolled out to additional Amazon stores in Seattle — an expansion that will make the system available across eight total Amazon physical retail stores, including […]

title: Amazon Earnings: What to Watch on Tuesday After the Market Close
text: Investors will soon learn how the COVID-19 pandemic affected the e-commerce titan's results for the fourth, or holiday, quarter.

title: Amazon Expands Palm Biometrics In Seattle
text: Three more Amazon Go stores in Seattle are being equipped with Amazon One palm-reading biometric identification scanners, Geekwire reported on Monday (Feb. 1). The eCommerce giant is adding the palm scanning equipment to two more Seattle stores, bringing the total to eight.
